svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
August 10, 2024" date: "2024-08-10"
Eth News and Links
All core devs
* All Core Devs - Consensus (ACDC) #139 : Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade:
Pectra-devnet-2 : a few client issues, tested recovery from non-finality
Pectra-devnet-3 : expected soon with EIP7702 (set EOA account code) Weekly testing
call: starts Monday EIP7594 PeerDAS : sampling to be ignored on next PeerDAS devnet
Node monitoring using discv5 : 42% of nodes use Lighthouse, 36% in US, 50% in data
centers
* Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade: Pectra-devnet-2 : a few client issues, tested
recovery from non-finality Pectra-devnet-3 : expected soon with EIP7702 (set EOA
account code) Weekly testing call: starts Monday EIP7594 PeerDAS : sampling to be
ignored on next PeerDAS devnet
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade:
* Pectra-devnet-2 : a few client issues, tested recovery from non-finality
* Pectra-devnet-3 : expected soon with EIP7702 (set EOA account code)
Pectra-devnet-3 : expected soon with EIP7702 (set EOA account code)
* Weekly testing call: starts Monday
Weekly testing call: starts Monday
* EIP7594 PeerDAS : sampling to be ignored on next PeerDAS devnet
EIP7594 PeerDAS : sampling to be ignored on next PeerDAS devnet
* Node monitoring using discv5 : 42% of nodes use Lighthouse, 36% in US, 50% in data
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade, likely targeting Q1 2025
* consensus-specs v1.5.0-alpha.4 : fixes off-by-one in MaxEB consolidation processing
consensus-specs v1.5.0-alpha.4 : fixes off-by-one in MaxEB consolidation processing
* PeerDAS: PeerDAS without peer sampling (SubnetDAS) proposal, minimal form of DAS
which can be shipped in a few months PeerDAS breakout #5
PeerDAS:
* PeerDAS without peer sampling (SubnetDAS) proposal, minimal form of DAS which can be
shipped in a few months
PeerDAS without peer sampling (SubnetDAS) proposal, minimal form of DAS which can be
* PeerDAS breakout #5
PeerDAS breakout #5
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.8% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.8% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
Consensus layer: Prysm 36% Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
* Consensus layer: Prysm 36%
Consensus layer: Prysm 36%
* Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America &
Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America & Europe
Layer 1
* Flashbots: TEE-Boost , proposal for validators to accept TEE proofs directly from
block builders, reduce & eventually remove relays in MEV-Boost
Research
* BRAID : multi-proposers by running multiple consensus processes in parallel, early
stage
Client Releases
* Consensus layer: Lighthouse v5.3.0 : faster beacon node startup, improved block
proposal reliability, improved validator client broadcast and gossipsub IDONTWANT
support Lodestar v1.21.0 : docker image changed to debian, adds execution layer client
info to graffiti and performance improvements via napi-rs BLST bindings Teku v24.8.0 :
updated metrics, requires Java 21+
Consensus layer:
* Lighthouse v5.3.0 : faster beacon node startup, improved block proposal reliability,
improved validator client broadcast and gossipsub IDONTWANT support
Lighthouse v5.3.0 : faster beacon node startup, improved block proposal reliability,
* Lodestar v1.21.0 : docker image changed to debian, adds execution layer client info
to graffiti and performance improvements via napi-rs BLST bindings
Lodestar v1.21.0 : docker image changed to debian, adds execution layer client info to
graffiti and performance improvements via napi-rs BLST bindings
* Teku v24.8.0 : updated metrics, requires Java 21+
Teku v24.8.0 : updated metrics, requires Java 21+
* Execution layer: Erigon v3.0.0-alpha2 : adds OtterSync fast sync by downloading
state via BitTorrent, improves chain tip performance and reduces disk footprint Reth
v1.0.4 : RPC fixes and resolves IO deadlock edge case during sync
Execution layer:
* Erigon v3.0.0-alpha2 : adds OtterSync fast sync by downloading state via BitTorrent,
improves chain tip performance and reduces disk footprint
Erigon v3.0.0-alpha2 : adds OtterSync fast sync by downloading state via BitTorrent,
* Reth v1.0.4 : RPC fixes and resolves IO deadlock edge case during sync
Reth v1.0.4 : RPC fixes and resolves IO deadlock edge case during sync
Layer 2
* Arbitrum Orbit chains bridged USDC as gas token
Arbitrum Orbit chains bridged USDC as gas token
* Mode, Zora & Metal upgrade ownership changed to Optimism Foundation & security
council
Mode, Zora & Metal upgrade ownership changed to Optimism Foundation & security council
EIPs/Standards
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7750 : Decentralized employment system ERC7751 :
Wrapping of bubbled up reverts ERC7752 : Equity token ERC7753 : Algorithmically
generated NFT ERC7754 : Tamperproof web immutable transaction
* ERC7750 : Decentralized employment system
ERC7750 : Decentralized employment system
* ERC7751 : Wrapping of bubbled up reverts
ERC7751 : Wrapping of bubbled up reverts
* ERC7752 : Equity token
ERC7752 : Equity token
* ERC7753 : Algorithmically generated NFT
ERC7753 : Algorithmically generated NFT
* ERC7754 : Tamperproof web immutable transaction
ERC7754 : Tamperproof web immutable transaction
Stuff for developers
* Solhint v5.0.3 : adds imports-order rule to sort Solidity imports topologically &
alphabetically
Solhint v5.0.3 : adds imports-order rule to sort Solidity imports topologically &
* Viem experimental adds EIP7702 (set EOA account code) support
Viem experimental adds EIP7702 (set EOA account code) support
* Rindexer (EVM indexing): adds streaming data & chatbot support
Rindexer (EVM indexing): adds streaming data & chatbot support
* Rainbow wallet extension impersonation mode
Rainbow wallet extension impersonation mode
* Tbl : CLI to read/edit Parquet files
Tbl : CLI to read/edit Parquet files
Security
* Ronin bridge $12M exploit via uninitialized parameter after upgrade, MEV bots front
ran, funds have been returned, $500k bounty
Job Listings
* Sablier are hiring a Business Development Lead and Frontend Engineer
Sablier are hiring a Business Development Lead and Frontend Engineer
* EF seek a European/Civil Law qualified Legal Counsel
EF seek a European/Civil Law qualified Legal Counsel
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Onchain stats
* Fees (via ultrasound.money ): Gas: 0.8 to 701.7 gwei, 10.3 gwei average; zero net
issuance at 23.9 gwei 10k ETH net issuance this week
Fees (via ultrasound.money ):
* Gas: 0.8 to 701.7 gwei, 10.3 gwei average; zero net issuance at 23.9 gwei
Gas: 0.8 to 701.7 gwei, 10.3 gwei average; zero net issuance at 23.9 gwei
* 10k ETH net issuance this week
10k ETH net issuance this week
* ETHUSD : $2,197 - $3,004, currently $2,601, all time high $4,878
ETHUSD : $2,197 - $3,004, currently $2,601, all time high $4,878
* ETHBTC : currently 0.043 (Flippening at ~0.164)
ETHBTC : currently 0.043 (Flippening at ~0.164)
Notable at app layer
* Zora secondary market for mints via hybrid ERC1155/ERC20 on Uniswap
Zora secondary market for mints via hybrid ERC1155/ERC20 on Uniswap
* Safe social recovery module by Candide
Safe social recovery module by Candide
Regulation/business/tokens
* SEC subpoena 3 crypto VCs in fishing expedition
SEC subpoena 3 crypto VCs in fishing expedition
* SEC loses to Ripple : judge sets fine at $125M, SEC had asked for $2B
SEC loses to Ripple : judge sets fine at $125M, SEC had asked for $2B
* New York Fed: Tornado Cash sanctions analysis
New York Fed: Tornado Cash sanctions analysis
General (Defcon edition)
* Gubsheep: programmable cryptography
Gubsheep: programmable cryptography
* Dark Skippy : malicious signing device can leak secret keys in transaction
signatures
Dark Skippy : malicious signing device can leak secret keys in transaction signatures
* Sinkclose AMD CPU vulnerability, run code in System Management Mode, requires kernel
access
Sinkclose AMD CPU vulnerability, run code in System Management Mode, requires kernel
* GhostWrite direct CPU bug in vulnerable RISC-V CPUs
GhostWrite direct CPU bug in vulnerable RISC-V CPUs
* Garuda and Pari : fast & small SNARKs via equifficient polynomial commitments
Garuda and Pari : fast & small SNARKs via equifficient polynomial commitments
END OF SERVICE: plan to deprecate Week in Ethereum News
Editor: @abcoathup Follow @WeekinEthNews for the most clicked links Permalink:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-august-10-2024
